 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָתַק‎</span>] **verb** ==pull, draw, tear away, apart, off== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְתַק‎</span> in derived species (rare), ***pull off, tear off***; Christian-Palestinian Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***shake off***, [[BDB#Schw|Schw]]<sup>Idioticon 58</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***pull off, draw out, shake***; [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>660</sup> compare Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***detrahere***, etc.); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 1 plural suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּנְתַקְּנוּהוּ‎</span> consecutive [[Judg.20.32|Judg 20:32]] (on dagesh forte dirimens see [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:20h»§ 20h</sup>); ***Imperfect*** 1 singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶתְּקֶנְךָּ‎</span> [[Jer.22.24|Jer 22:24]] (compare [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:58»§ 58</sup>, i); ***Passive participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָתוּק‎</span> [[Lev.22.24|Lev 22:24]] — 

**1.** ***draw away*** warriors from (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span>) city, unto (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span>) high road [[Judg.20.32|Judg 20:32]]. 

**2.** ***draw*** or ***pull off*** ring from (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span>) finger [[Jer.22.24|Jer 22:24]] (figurative of rejection of king of Judah by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>). 

**3.** ***pull, tear away*** [[Lev.22.24|Lev 22:24]] (passive, of testicles, + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָעוּךְ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּתוּת‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּרוּת‎</span>). **Niph\`al** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִתַּק‎</span> [[Isa.5.27|Isa 5:27]] 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִתְּקוּ‎</span> [[Josh.4.18|Josh 4:18]]; [[Job.17.11|Job 17:11]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִתָּ֑קוּ‎</span> [[Jer.6.29|Jer 6:29]]; [[Jer.10.20|Jer 10:20]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִנָּתֵק‎</span> [[Judg.16.9|Judg 16:9]] + 2 t.; 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּנָָּֽתְקוּ‎</span> [[Josh.8.16|Josh 8:16]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִנָּתֵ֑קוּ‎</span> [[Isa.33.20|Isa 33:20]] — 

**1.** ***be drawn away*** from (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span>) city [[Josh.8.16|Josh 8:16]] (compare **Qal 1**);== of soles of feet==, ***be drawn out*** (from water) unto (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span>) dry ground [[Josh.4.18|Josh 4:18]]. 

**2.** ***be torn apart***, or ***in two, snapped:*** of sandal-thong [[Isa.5.27|Isa 5:27]], strand of tow [[Judg.16.9|Judg 16:9]] (simile), cord [[Eccl.4.12|Eccl 4:12]] especially tent-cord (in figurative) [[Isa.33.20|Isa 33:20]]; [[Jer.10.20|Jer 10:20]], so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִנָּתֵק מֵאָהֳלוֺ מִבְטַחוֺ‎</span> [[Job.18.14|Job 18:14]] metaphor of plans (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זִמֹּת‎</span>) [[Job.17.11|Job 17:11]]. 

**3.** ***be separated***, in smelting, figurative, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָעִים לֹא נִתָּ֑קוּ‎</span> [[Jer.6.29|Jer 6:29]]. **Pi\`el** ***Perfect*** 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִתַּקְתִּי‎</span> [[Jer.2.20|Jer 2:20]] 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִתְּקוּ‎</span> [[Jer.5.5|Jer 5:5]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְנַתֵּק‎</span> [[Ezek.17.9|Ezek 17:9]]; [[Ps.107.14|Ps 107:14]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְנַתֵּק‎</span> [[Judg.16.9|Judg 16:9]], suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְנַתְּקֵם‎</span> v[[Judg.16.12|Judg 16:12]] 2 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּנַתֵּ֑קִי‎</span> [[Ezek.23.34|Ezek 23:34]] 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲנַתֵּק‎</span> [[Nah.1.13|Nah 1:13]] 1 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְנַתְּקָה‎</span> cohortative [[Ps.2.3|Ps 2:3]] 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּנַתֵּ֑קוּ‎</span> [[Isa.58.6|Isa 58:6]] — 

**1.** ***tear apart, snap***, with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַיְתָרִים‎</span> [[Judg.16.9|Judg 16:9]] ***the cords***, v[[Judg.16.12|Judg 16:12]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵעַל זְרֹעֹתָיו‎</span>); especially with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוֺסֵרוֺת‎</span>, ***bonds*** (figurative) [[Nah.1.13|Nah 1:13]]; [[Jer.2.20|Jer 2:20]]; [[Jer.5.5|Jer 5:5]]; [[Jer.30.8|Jer 30:8]]; [[Ps.2.3|Ps 2:3]]; [[Ps.107.14|Ps 107:14]] object <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוֺטָה‎</span> [[Isa.58.6|Isa 58:6]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פַּתֵּחַ‎</span>, and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַתֵּר אֲגֻדּוֺת מוֺטָה‎</span>). 

**2.** ***tear out, up***, object roots [[Ezek.17.9|Ezek 17:9]] (in figurative); ***tear out, away***, object breasts [[Ezek.23.34|Ezek 23:34]] (in violent figurative of Jerusalem as drunken woman). 

**Hiph\`il 1.** ***Infinitive construct*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַתִּיקֵנוּ‎</span>: ***draw away*** warriors from (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span>) city [[Josh.8.6|Josh 8:6]] (= **Qal 1**). 

**2.** ***Imperative*** masculine singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַתִּקֵם‎</span> ***drag them away*** like sheep to slaughter [[Jer.12.3|Jer 12:3]] (of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>'s dealing with wicked). **Hoph\`al** ***Perfect*** (si vera lectio) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָנְתְּקוּ מִןהָֿעִיר‎</span> [[Judg.20.31|Judg 20:31]] ***they were drawn away from the city*** (compare **Niph\`al 1**), but probably gloss, see [[BDB#GFM|GFM]].
